p: While Johnsongrass home habitat SOC had a slightly negative effect on chlorophyll content of irrigated plants, it had a positive effect on chlorophyll content in unirrigated plants (see Fig. 3B). Thus, the irrigation treatment was responsible for a 67 % greater difference in chlorophyll content between samples from SOC-poor habitats (180 mg m −2, on average) than on those from SOC-rich habitats (120 mg m −2, on average).
